intro: Cyphostigma pubescens, commonly known as the hairy cyphostigma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is relatively rare in the wild.
